means: 绞接( splice的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He spliced the two lengths of film together.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把两段胶卷粘接起来.

sentence.Network_en: The film will be spliced with footage of Cypress Hill to be filmed in America.
sentence.Network_cn: 这部电影要和将在美国拍摄的柏树山乐队的音乐片段粘接在一起。

sentence.Network_en: An old friend of mine, newly spliced, recently invited me to dinner in his new marital home.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的一位刚结婚不久的老朋友最近邀请我到他的婚房去吃晚饭。

选择性剪接（Alternative splicing）是基因的一种表现方式。生物的基因序列中，包含了内含子（intron）与外显子（exon），两者交 …
可变剪接(alternative splicing)是产生高等真核生物蛋白质多样性的重要分子调控机制之一,众多研究表明,可变剪接可以改变蛋白质的结.

entry.tran: 绞接(绳子);粘接(胶片、磁带等)
entry.def: If you splice two pieces of rope, film, or tape together, you join them neatly at the ends so that they make one continuous piece.

example.ex: He taught me to edit and splice film...
example.tran: 他教我剪辑和粘接胶片。

example.ex: The film will be spliced with footage of Cypress Hill to be filmed in America.
example.tran: 这部电影要和将在美国拍摄的柏树山乐队的音乐片段粘接在一起。

entry.def: When two people get spliced, they get married.

example.ex: An old friend of mine, newly spliced, recently invited me to dinner in his new marital home.
example.tran: 我的一位刚结婚不久的老朋友最近邀请我到他的婚房去吃晚饭。

auth_sentence.content: Spliced to an immature glorifying of war as some sort of machismo virtue.

auth_sentence.content: So he spliced together his own chart from various price indexes and studies.
auth_sentence.res_content: So he spliced together his own chart from various price indexes and studies.

auth_sentence.content: Thom Yorke and his band of merry men have taken the musical landscape and toyed, spliced and even at times mollycoddled it.
